title: Workshop program
text:
Note



Please note that the program is preliminary and might be subject to change, especially the exact schedule.


All times are in Central European Summer Time (CEST).







Time
Event




10:00 - 10:10

10:10 - 10:30
Introduction to Julia & Unfold.jl


10:30 - 11:30

11:30 - 11:45
Break â˜•

12:45 - 13:45

14:45 - 15:00

Each lesson consists of a lecture (~ 30min) and a subsequent exercise (~30min).

title: Registration
text:
Note



Since our capacity for the practical exercises is limited, we will only be able to accept ~50 participants for the workshop. However, the lectures will also be available via livestream, and everyone is invited to follow along independently.


To register for the free Unfold.jl workshop, please fill out the form below until 07.05.2025. We will inform you via email if you got a place and share the Zoom link.

title: Installation guide
text: To actively participate in the workshop and use the notebooks we provided, you will need to install both Julia and Pluto.jl on your system. The following is a minimal guide on how to do this. You can find more extensive information in the Pluto.jl documentation (which this guide is based on) and also watch their instruction video.

title: Installation guide
text:
Step 1: Installing Julia
In most cases, going to https://julialang.org/downloads and installing the current stable release is sufficient.
However, if you plan to use Julia in the future, we recommend installing Julia through a version manager like juliaup. This allows you to easily switch between different Julia versions. You can find more information about juliaup here.

title: Installation guide
text:
Step 2: Run Julia
Make sure that you can run Julia. To do this, open a termminal and type julia. You should then see the below startup message and your terminal should say â€œjuliaâ€.

title: Installation guide
text:
Step 3: Install Pluto
To install Pluto type
import Pkg; Pkg.add("Pluto")
into the Julia terminal (i.e.Â after step 2)

title: Installation guide
text:
Step 4: Run Pluto
To run Pluto.jl, simply type the following in the Julia terminal:
import Pluto; Pluto.run()
This will start up a Pluto session and automatically open your browser.
And then you are all done and ready for the workshop ğŸ‰

title: Installation guide
text:
Initial setup
As running the notebooks on different systems and at different times might lead to package conflicts and waiting times we kindly ask two more things of you:

We are providing a â€œpackage installationâ€ notebook. This will make sure that everyone will be using the same package versions. Please run this one before any of the other notebooks.
Initializing the notebooks might take time, as Pluto runs all cells when you click â€œrun notebookâ€. Please open and initialize each notebook before the workshop.

title: Welcome! ğŸ™
text: Welcome to the first official Unfold.jl workshop! Here you will learn everything to be able to do your first Unfold analysis! The workshop will be free and fully online, so you can join from anywhere in the world.

title: Welcome! ğŸ™
text:
What even is Unfold? ğŸ¤”
Unfold.jl is a Julia Package for regression and event-based time series analysis, with a focus on regression ERPs for EEG analysis.
If youâ€™re not already familiar with Unfold or regression ERPâ€™s, we recommend you to read the original publication by Ehinger & Dimigen.

title: Welcome! ğŸ™
text:
Material covered ğŸ’ª
During the workshop we will cover everything from mass-univariate modeling of EEG data to marginalized effects and overlap correction. For more information please have a look at our (preliminary) schedule.
